meanings.definition: (verb) To tease or lead someone on sexually without following through.
meanings.sent1: She would often blueball him by flirting but never agreeing to a date.
meanings.sent2: He felt upset when she blueballed him by saying she liked him but then ignoring him.
meanings.sent3: The friends joked that she would always blueball him by pretending to be interested.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were like a blueball, promising something exciting but never delivering.
meanings.sent5: The term 'blueball' perfectly captures the frustration of unfulfilled desire.

meanings.definition: (noun) A feeling of frustration or disappointment resulting from being teased or led on sexually.
meanings.sent1: His blueball was evident when she canceled their plans last minute.
meanings.sent2: She felt a deep blueball after he flirted with her all night but then left with someone else.
meanings.sent3: The group laughed at his blueball when she said she would call him but never did.
meanings.sent4: The blueball he experienced was like a dark cloud hanging over his evening.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of blueball lingered long after the party ended.
